page.title: 08N. Lopham School Today
page.content: Our school is called St. Andrew's. The school has 3 teachers and the age range is rising 5's to 11's. There is a infant class, a 1st and 2nd year class and a 3rd and 4th year class. There are about 70 pupils. When you are a 4th year, you leave North Lopham school and most of us go to Diss High. The school has a meadow, 2 climbing frames and 2 playgrounds. The work we do is History, Maths, English, Science, Geography, Art, Games, etc. We have 3 playtimes. There is a canteen where we have lunch. We go swimming every week. The school teaches children from 3 villages - North Lopham, South Lopham and Blo Norton. Our biggest problem is the poor standard of decoration and repair. Staff and parents have been trying to get improvements for some time.
